Almouse 06-Aug-19 06:21 AM
releaseparticleindex informs the engine that it's safe to re-allocate that particle index, you also need DestroyParticle
for ongoing particles you want to do
local particle = ParticleManager:CreateParticle(...) -- some time later ParticleManager:DestroyParticle(particle, ...) ParticleManager:ReleaseParticleIndex(particle)
for "instantaneous" particles it's usually safe to do
ParticleManager:ReleaseParticleIndex(ParticleManager:CreateParticle(...))
, I believe
DeeKai 06-Aug-19 06:24 AM
i used bloodrage so its ongoing
void DestroyParticle(int particleID, bool immediately)
i suppose it true? for bool
Almouse 06-Aug-19 06:25 AM
immediately determines if the particle should be allowed to play its "end" effects, i believe

DeeKai 06-Aug-19 06:38 AM

Almouse 06-Aug-19 06:38 AM
if you instantiate a variable with local, it will be trapped inside the scope that created it
you could instead do e.g. self.particle = ParticleManager:CreateParticle(...)
and then every function for that modifier can access self.particle
paying attention to IsServer() things, which could cause problems
so you could try and have a structure like
function modifier:OnIncrementStackCount() if not self.particle then self.particle = CreateParticle(...) end end function modifier:OnDecrementStackCount() if self.particle and self:GetStackCount == 0 then ParticleManager:DestroyParticle(...) ParticleManager:ReleaseParticleIndex(...) self.particle = nil end end
DeeKai 06-Aug-19 06:46 AM

DeeKai 06-Aug-19 06:55 AM
function modifier_madness:OnIncrementStackCount() if not self.particle then self.particle = ParticleManager:CreateParticle(particle_cast, PATTACH_ABSORIGIN_FOLLOW, attacker) end end function modifier_madness:OnDecrementStackCount() if self.particle and self:GetStackCount() == 0 then ParticleManager:DestroyParticle(self.particle, false) ParticleManager:ReleaseParticleIndex(self.particle) self.particle = nil end end
function modifier_madness:PlayEffects(attacker) local particle_cast = "particles/units/heroes/hero_bloodseeker/bloodseeker_bloodrage.vpcf" end

Elfansoer 06-Aug-19 12:00 PM
the key with Reactive Armor stack is that the stack modifier only used to decrease stack count
function modifier_slark_essence_shift_lua_stack:OnRemoved() if IsServer() then self.modifier:RemoveStack() end end
this is the most important part: RemoveStack
So, the logic behind Slark's passive is this: 1. modifier_slark_essence_shift_lua grants bonuses from stack 2.modifier_slark_essence_shift_lua listens to every attack 3. when attack happens, add stack modifier, that DOES NOTHING but to reduce stack count when that stack modifier get destroyed

I used it to send modifier reference through OnCreated
that stack modifier?
DeeKai 06-Aug-19 10:30 PM
modifier_madness_stack = class({}) local tempTable = require("utils/tempTable") -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Classifications function modifier_madness_stack:IsHidden() return true end function modifier_madness_stack:IsPurgable() return false end function modifier_madness_stack:GetAttributes() return 0 +MODIFIER_ATTRIBUTE_MULTIPLE end -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Initializations function modifier_madness_stack:OnCreated( kv ) if IsServer() then self.modifier = tempTable:RetATValue( kv.modifier ) end end function modifier_madness_stack:OnRemoved() if IsServer() then self.modifier:RemoveStack() end end
this is the whole stack modifier
Elfansoer 06-Aug-19 10:31 PM
yes. tempTable:RetATValue is used to obtain self.modifier, which is a reference to modifier_madness modifier
DeeKai 06-Aug-19 10:32 PM
ah
Elfansoer 06-Aug-19 10:32 PM
and then when it get destroyed (duration is up), it calls RemoveStack on modifier_madness, thus decreasing the stack (and stuff related to it)
so the modifier actually does nothing but to decrement main modifier's stack after some time

Elfansoer 07-Aug-19 08:33 PM
@Eri this is not costly
local respawntime = { [1] = 5, [2] = 7, [3] = 9.3, [4] = 10.1, [5] = 17, [6] = 55, [7] = 2, } return respawntime[ self:GetParent():GetLevel() ]
Elfansoer 07-Aug-19 08:40 PM
Or, for more complex, you can try this
local respawntime = { [1] = function( self ) return 5 end, [2] = function( self ) local x = 5 * self:GetParent():GetStrength() return x/2 end, [3] = function( self ) local dist = (self:GetParent():GetOrigin()-self:GetCaster():GetOrigin()):Length2D() if dist<10 then return 5 else return 25 end end, [0] = function( self ) return 5 end } local f = respawntime[ self:GetParent():GetLevel() ] or respawntime[0] return f( self )

Abraham Blinkin' 08-Aug-19 12:24 PM
When I try to run this code, the console reports that HasEmptyAibility() is a nil method. Help?
function GetEmptyAbility() if HasAbility("ability_empty1") then return "ability_empty1" elseif HasAbility("ability_empty2") then return "ability_empty1" elseif HasAbility("ability_empty3") then return "ability_empty1" elseif HasAbility("ability_empty4") then return "ability_empty1" else end end function GiveAbility(str1, str2) if str2:HasAbility(str1) then Warning("You already have this ability!") elseif str2:HasEmptyAbility(str2) == true then local oldAbility = str2:GetEmptyAbility() local abilityPoints = str2:GetEmptyAbility():GetLevel() str2:AddAbility(str1) str2:FindAbilityByName(str1):SetLevel(abilityPoints) str2:SwapAbilities(str1, oldAbility, true, false) str2:RemoveAbility(oldAbility) else local SlotTable = {0,1,2,5} local abilityIndex = SlotTable[RandomInt(1,4)] local oldAbility = heroEntity:GetAbilityByIndex(abilityIndex):GetAbilityName() local abilityPoints = heroEntity:GetAbilityByIndex(abilityIndex):GetLevel() str2:AddAbility(str1) str2:FindAbilityByName(str1):SetLevel(abilityPoints) str2:SwapAbilities(str1, oldAbility, true, false) str2:RemoveAbility(oldAbility) end end function HasEmptyAbility(str2) if str2:HasAbility("ability_empty1") then return true elseif str2:HasAbility("ability_empty2") then return true elseif str2:HasAbility("ability_empty3") then return true elseif str2:HasAbility("ability_empty4") then return true else return false end end
Almouse 08-Aug-19 12:25 PM
str2:HasEmptyAbility(str2) this line in GiveAbility
and other lines in there
you're defining HasEmptyAbility(x) to be a function, but then you're calling it like it's a method
